column4: my / partition is 99% filled up. & i got a warning!!! any help!!!
my / partition is 99% filled up. & i got a warning!!! any hjelp!!! can i empty my /tmp???
reboot and /tmp ought to be emptied
ok, and any other place i migt empty? to free space?
remove old logs from /var/log/ . purge/deinstall unneeded software . install and use !localepurge and finally manually clean out your ~/ directory
do i delete all files in /var/log to empty space?
no no .. just the old ones -- e.g. the old versions of /var/log/messages might be messages.0.gz, messages.1.gz etc
oh got it!!! but they are too many!!!
usually -- you can remove all the ones matching *gz .. check them with this command - ls /var/log/*gz  . if you are happy that they are all old .. you can use this - sudo rm -/var/log/*gz
yep, localepurge is a good thing, it monitors when you install packages next and will clean up after you then too :)
how do i remove the games i got preinstalled with gnome?
errm, you can use the add/remove programs thingy -- or manually install them
can u please tell me the manual way of uninstalling them?
